title: Honorific for Marcus Cestius, primus pilus and duumvir

editionAuthor.title: Siciliae obiacentium insular et Bruttiorum antiquae tabulae cum animadversionibus Georgii Gualtheri
editionAuthor.citation: G. Gualtherus, Siciliae obiacentium insular et Bruttiorum antiquae tabulae cum animadversionibus Georgii Gualtheri (Panormi, 1624)

support: Likely to be either a statue base or a plaque from a base, but no details are recorded.

layout.p: Gualtherus presents the text over four lines, the name filling line 1.

handNote.lettering: No details recorded, other than that Gualtherus marks a tall I in line 2 ('pilo').

date._: Most likely to be one of the first generation of colonial settlers, and so probably Augustan in date, and (as Wilson 1990, p.369 n.58) unlikely to be later than Claudius.

provenanceFound._: Observed by Gualtherus (1624) in the 'praetorium', i.e. town hall of Termini Imerese; but not seen subsequently.
